channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The highest-paying trade jobs in the U.S. include one paying over $100,000 per year—but you’ll have to be comfortable with tight spaces and heights
item.description: With AI threatening to steal corporate jobs and recent graduates finding themselves “unemployable”, trade jobs are becoming increasingly attractive—and lucrative.

item.title: 5 things to know before the stock market opens
item.description: Here are the most important news items that investors need to start their trading day.

item.title: BP joins Exxon in warning over weak refining margins
How an ideological war over PrEP threatens preventive services from smoking cessation to contraception to vaccines for half the U.S. population
item.description: More than 150 million Americans now have access to preventive services—and these are popular across the political spectrum.

item.title: Tuesday's analyst calls: Nvidia to pop 40%, Netflix gets a price target increase
item.description: A streaming giant and a semiconductor maker were among the stocks being talked about by analysts on Tuesday.

item.title: Thames Water says it has enough money until the end of May
Millennial law grad quit her director job in Monaco to launch a second-hand store with her mom—now she sells designer bags and bling at $3,200 a pop and treats her husband to Audemars Piguet
item.description: “Don’t take a job for the money. Take a job for what you can learn and for the passion,” says Sellier’s founder Hanushka Toni.

item.title: France's Macron always wanted more power and influence in Europe. He'll now have less
item.description: French President Emmanuel Macron's failed snap election gamble is likely to take a huge toll on his political ambitions and legacy, analysts say.

item.title: U.K. retail sales fell in June due to colder weather, says survey
New Hollywood power player David Ellison outlines his ‘essential’ vision for Paramount to transition into a ‘tech hybrid’
item.description: That includes plans to “rebuild” the Paramount+ streaming service.

item.title: Barcelona protesters throw items and spray travelers with water while shouting ‘tourists go home’
item.description: The protesters — angry about the city's long-standing problems with overtourism — also used tape to block hotel entrances and sidewalk cafes in Barceloneta.

item.title: Sorry, but retiring ‘comfortably’ on $100K is a myth for most people. Here’s why
The man dubbed ‘Britain’s Warren Buffett’ blames falling vet visits—not his refusal to back Nvidia—for poor performance of U.K.’s biggest fund
item.description: Smith's popular fund has again underperformed the benchmark, prompting him to defend his Nvidia stance once more.

item.title: BP shares drop 3% after warning of up to $2 billion impairment, weak refining margins
item.description: BP on Tuesday said it expects to post an impairment of up to $2 billion in the second quarter, also warning of lower refining margins.

item.title: Trump and GOP's promises to defend crypto are 'history' making for the industry
